intro: Chromolaena parviceps, commonly known as the small-headed chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Chromolaena parviceps is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
